remarks.format:
## Remarks
Setting this property to `false` has a similar effect to calling <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostingHostBuilderExtensions.ConfigureDefaults(Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder,System.String[])>.
Setting this property to `false` has a similar effect to calling <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostingHostBuilderExtensions.ConfigureDefaults(Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder,System.String[])>.
The following defaults are applied to the <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder>:
* Set the <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostEnvironment.ContentRootPath> to the result of <xref:System.IO.Directory.GetCurrentDirectory>. * Load <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration> from "DOTNET_" prefixed environment variables. * Load <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration> from 'appsettings.json' and 'appsettings.[<xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostEnvironment.EnvironmentName>].json'. * Load <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration> from User Secrets when <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostEnvironment.EnvironmentName> is 'Development' using the entry assembly. * Load <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration> from environment variables. * Load <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration> from supplied command line arguments. * Configure the <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory> to log to the console, debug, and event source output. * Enables scope validation on the dependency injection container when <xref:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostEnvironment.EnvironmentName> is 'Development'.
